post_text: As you know we have been working around the clock with planning for reopening. We have been monitoring cases related to COVID infection across the country as schools reopen. We have revived hundreds of questions and concerns from staff and parents. Many of which have caused us to revisit our plan and make modifications. After very careful consideration and deliberation we have decided to switch to a total remote platform for MVCSD beginning September 10 - October 2. This will allow for staff to better prepare for the school year. We will continue to assess conditions along the way, and revisit our plan to launch our hybrid models to launch in October . We realize that there is no solution that is ideal for everyone but it is our belief this is the safest approach for staff and our students. Of course we will continue to update you along the way.

Districts are not permitted to accept ballots through alternative means such as drop off boxes after 5 pm on June 9, 2020. Our ballot box at the Education Center will be closed and secured at this time.

post_text: Good Afternoon --- The Governor has just announced that schools will be closed for the rest of this academic year. While we are all very anxious to resume some normalcy, at least now we have some finality to what our next steps will be. I understand that many parents are trying to balance work, family, and now homeschooling. We will get through this together.

Ms. Friedman's sixth- and seventh-grade students from Pennington worked on a workbook to help kids cope during the coronavirus pandemic called "First Aid for Feeling." Students collaboratively read the passage called "A Changing World." Students had a discussion about the changes that have happened in the world, as well as, the changes they have been facing at home during this pandemic.

Students then watched the video called "We Wear Masks - A Social Story about the Coronavirus." Students had a discussion about why we have to wear a mask when we go outside and when we enter into different places in our environment (i.e., the supermarket). Students all grabbed their masks that they had at home and put them on for a "Class Mask Selfie." Ms. Friedman's teaching assistants are Mr. Taj, Mr. Williams, and Ms. Burgher.
